bug.short_desc: Provide Additional Parameters to ImageMagick 'montage' Command

long_desc.thetext:
Jean-Noel Rivasseau changed the line:
montage_cmd = "montage -geometry +0+0 -gravity NorthWest -tile %s -background None %s %s"
to
montage_cmd = "montage -depth 8 -quality 100 -geometry +0+0 -gravity NorthWest -tile %s -background None %s %s"
(Mind the -depth and -quality options).
He wrote: "I really urge you to apply this change upstream as it allowed my big combined image to go from a size of 336K to 188K (and keep the same quality level since it is PNG...). The best would be to be able to specify the quality in the options maybe, but for PNG a value of 100 makes sense as a default (and the important thing is really to change the image depth)."
This should be a minor thing to get it done, but still can't promise to get it into the 1.5 release. We will see if we have enough time so I put it on the target milestone.

I don't think we should set it to 8 as a hard value, because this would mean that we implicitly change *all* PNG which are combined from 32 bit to 8 bit PNGs.
Maybe there are some images which are using more than 256 colors and this would then ending up in display problems due a image combination. An optimization should not "break" images.
However, I think we can define at least a value of 32 to reduce the image size. Additionally it should be later on possible to configure this so everyone is able to use an own value.

= Update =
The most suitable "depth" is 24 since all PNG images have a color depth of 24 bit as default. So reducing from 64 to 24 should be possible and save some bytes.

Hello,
a parameter of 8 given to montage will, I think, create a PNG with a depth of 24. That's why I think it should be given as a default parameter.
(What I mean is that the parameter given to montage is not equal to the bit depth of the generated PNG).

(In reply to comment #4) > a parameter of 8 given to montage will, I think, create a PNG with a depth of > 24. That's why I think it should be given as a default parameter. > > (What I mean is that the parameter given to montage is not equal to the bit > depth of the generated PNG). Maybe I misunderstood the ImageMagick website. Here's a excerpt of the desccription of the "depth" parameter:
--snip-- This the number of bits in a color sample within a pixel. Use this option to specify the depth of raw images whose depth is unknown such as GRAY, RGB, or CMYK, or to change the depth of any image after it has been read. --snip--
Doesn't this describe the color depth of the image?
Here's the link to the description: http://www.imagemagick.org/script/command-line-options.php?#depth
